name: Human
description: Humans are the most adaptable and widespread of all peoples — medium height, broad variety of skin tones, hair, and eye colors. They lack the exotic features of other races, yet their sheer diversity and ingenuity define them.

Human societies vary from nomadic tribes to skybound empires. What binds them is ambition — an endless drive to build, explore, and outlast. While some races see them as reckless, others admire their resilience; humanity’s strength lies in reinvention.

trait.name: Versatile Spirit
trait.description: Gain one additional 1 Trait Point at character creation. Once per Rest, reroll a failed check involving any skill.

name: Elf
description: Elves are tall and slender, with sharp features and eyes that seem to reflect distant starlight. Their lifespans stretch far beyond those of most peoples, granting them patience and long memory.
Elven cultures prize artistry, precision, and restraint. Though often seen as aloof, elves feel deeply — they simply express emotion with careful control.

trait.name: Keen Senses
trait.description: You have advantage on checks involving perception, awareness, or detecting hidden details.

name: Dwarf
description: Dwarves are short and broad, with dense musculature and features hardened by generations spent underground. Their voices carry weight, and their presence feels immovable.
Dwarven societies value tradition, craftsmanship, and honor. To a dwarf, a well-made thing is a form of truth.

trait.name: Stone-Enduring
trait.description: You gain +1 Guard. You have advantage on checks to resist fatigue, poison, or environmental hardship.

name: Halfling
description: Halflings are short and light-footed, with quick hands and quicker smiles. Though physically unimposing, they possess a quiet resilience.
Many underestimate halflings — a mistake they often survive through cleverness, luck, or both.

trait.name: Fortunate
trait.description: After rolling, you may reroll one die and take the new result.

name: Orc
description: Orcs are tall, broad-shouldered, and physically imposing, with tusks or pronounced canines and skin tones ranging from gray to deep green.
Orc cultures are diverse but often emphasize strength, survival, and emotional honesty. Their passions burn hot and fast.

trait.name: Relentless
trait.description: When reduced to 0 Health, you may immediately take one action before falling unconscious.

name: Tiefling
description: Tieflings bear visible signs of otherworldly heritage — horns, tails, unusual eyes, or faint embers beneath the skin.
Feared or mistrusted by many, tieflings learn early to command attention or bend perceptions.

trait.name: Infernal Presence
trait.description: You gain advantage on intimidation and influence checks against creatures that can see you.

name: Gnome
description: Gnomes are small, sharp-featured people with bright eyes and restless hands. Their minds move quickly, often faster than their speech.
They are natural tinkerers, illusionists, and scholars, finding joy in discovery for its own sake.

trait.name: Quick Thinker
trait.description: After seeing the result of a roll, you may add +1 to the total.

name: Dragonborn
description: Dragonborn are tall and imposing, bearing scales, tails, or crests reminiscent of true dragons.
Their cultures emphasize honor, lineage, and controlled strength.

trait.name: Draconic Presence
trait.description: You gain advantage on checks to resist fear. Once per Rest, gain advantage on an intimidation roll.

name: Goblin
description: Goblins are small, sharp-eared, and wiry, with quick reflexes and quicker instincts.
Though often underestimated, goblins excel at survival through cleverness and adaptability.

trait.name: Scurry
trait.description: After taking an action, you may move 1 space without spending an action.

name: Fae
description: Fae appear humanoid but carry subtle wrongness — glowing eyes, shifting shadows, or unnatural beauty.
Their minds and bodies are bound to magic, contracts, and strange rules of conduct.

trait.name: Glamour
trait.description: You may impose disadvantage on a social roll made against you.

name: Lizardfolk
description: Lizardfolk are reptilian humanoids with scaled skin and slit pupils, adapted to harsh environments.
They approach life pragmatically, valuing survival and utility over abstract ideals.

trait.name: Natural Armor
trait.description: Your unarmored Armor is increased by +1.

name: Aasimar
description: Aasimar often appear human but carry signs of divine heritage — glowing eyes, radiant marks, or an unshakable calm.
They are frequently burdened by expectations placed upon them by others.

trait.name: Radiant Soul
trait.description: You may automatically succeed on a single Charm-based roll.

name: Construct
description: Constructs are built, not born — formed of metal, stone, wood, or other materials, animated by arcane or mechanical means.
Their struggle often lies in defining identity beyond their original purpose.

trait.name: Artificial Body
trait.description: You have advantage on rolls to resist poison, disease, and exhaustion.

name: Beastfolk
description: Beastfolk resemble humanoids with animal features such as fur, tails, ears, or claws.
Their cultures vary widely, often influenced by the instincts of their animal heritage.

trait.name: Bestial Instinct
trait.description: Choose one: advantage on tracking, climbing, swimming, or hearing-based checks.

name: Dinqui - Zone 3
description: Stocky, sharp-featured, and thick-skinned, the Dinqui resemble gargoyle-like goblinoids with small wings of stone and horn. Their eyes glimmer like polished gems, and their voices carry a gravelly timbre.

Once guardians of ancient temples, the Dinqui now live among ruins and crag cities, carving art from mountain faces. They value endurance, tradition, and community over conquest, measuring worth by what one can craft or protect.

trait.name: Stonebound Resilience
trait.description: Gain +2 Armor and resistance to physical damage from falling or impact. Once per Rest, you can harden fully into stone for 1 turn, becoming immune to all damage but unable to act.

name: Ashten - Zone 3
description: Ashten appear as tall, imposing humanoids with horns of varying shape, glowing eyes, and fissured skin that crackles with contained magical energy. Their tones range from obsidian to copper, often veined with light.

Legends claim the Ashten were born when ancient mortals struck bargains with primal forces of fire and aether. Rather than succumbing, they became vessels of both creation and destruction. Today they form disciplined orders and city-fortresses, guided by philosophy rather than faith.

trait.name: Aetherblood Surge
trait.description: When you take damage, you may release your inner energy. Deal 2 Arcane Damage to all enemies within 1 tile and gain +1 Armor for 2 turns.

name: Khraa - Zone 3
description: The Khraa are tall, agile humanoids with lithe, muscular builds and four arms — two dominant and two lighter, more dexterous limbs. Their faces resemble either feline or canine ancestry, with expressive ears, slit or bright eyes, and soft fur patterns across the shoulders and arms.

Nomadic hunters and skyborn raiders, the Khraa value motion and freedom above all. Their cities are built high in cliffs or massive canopy networks, and each clan maintains a Path Code — a philosophy blending honor, challenge, and self-expression. They’re fiercely loyal to their kin and quick to laughter or rage.

trait.name: Fourfold Precision
trait.description: You may wield an additional one-handed weapon or perform two off-hand actions per turn. Gain +1 Accuracy on all melee attacks made while dual wielding or climbing.

name: Eladri - Zone 3
description: Eladri are tall and slender with luminescent, fully colored eyes that glow faintly in dim light. Their tails, long and prehensile, express subtle emotion. Their skin shimmers with faint undertones — often silvers, blues, or violets — and their hair tends toward iridescent hues.

Born of stars and dreams, the Eladri believe themselves descended from the echoes of forgotten constellations. They dwell in crystalline cities suspended between dimensions, where light refracts into living color. Their scholars study not only arcane forces, but the geometry of existence itself. Outsiders see them as distant, but their curiosity for mortal emotion often draws them into the wider world.

trait.name: Starlit Anima
trait.description: You may spend 1 Mana to gain +2 Reflex or +2 Accuracy until your next turn. Once per Rest, you can see invisible or hidden entities for 1 minute.
